events.summary: Day 1 of the Cortes at Valladolid. Juan opens with a speech about the crusade's victories but receives a cold reception (Roll 33). Proposes 8% crusade tax. Nobles resist (Roll 28 — Minimal Movement). Juan pivots with humility — voluntarily surrenders authority and offers Dec 1433 hard deadline (Roll 30 — Warming). Don Rodrigo Manrique and Don Pedro de Velasco show the math doesn't work for smaller houses. Juan concedes to 5% rate. The vote passes 52-3-5 with strong support (Roll 41). Crusade Tax Law enacted at 5% with levy compensation.

exchanges.text: Fellow knights of Castille, when we met last year we were about to start our crusade...
Roll 33 — Cold reception. Roll 28 — Minimal movement on tax. Roll 30 — Warming. Roll 41 — Strong support. Law passed.

events.summary: Day 2 of the Cortes. Juan announces the excommunication of three nobles who threatened or assaulted his tax assessors: Gómez de Sotomayor, Baron de Medina, and Count of Niebla. Their lands are declared forfeit to the crown. Roll 48 — the assembly accepts with mixed feelings. Some nobles nervous about the precedent but most recognize the three went too far. Juan announces the Crown Marshal system (Roll 20 — Mixed Positive, Relief Emerging). Nobles relieved that enforcement follows structured procedures rather than arbitrary punishment.

exchanges.text: We have had those who have not only refused but threatened my assessors. They are excommunicated.
Roll 48 — Accepted with tension. Marshal decree announced. Roll 20 — Relief that system is structured.

events.summary: Day 3 of the Cortes. Juan announces the Eternal Crusade vision — once Granada falls, Castile will continue crusading in North Africa, offering permanent opportunities for noble glory, land, and military service. Roll 53 — Modest Positive response. Younger nobles excited by prospect of conquest and glory. Older nobles cautious about overextension. The Cortes concludes with all three major items addressed: crusade tax law passed, excommunications announced, eternal crusade vision shared.

exchanges.text: Knights of Castille, we are about to complete the reconquista. But this is not the end...
Roll 53 — Modest positive. Mixed reactions but vision planted.
